question: A block level container (or 'division' of the web page) for content with no semantic meaning.
Tag that surrounds important content that is invisible to the user, but is important to the browser.
Hyperlinks (or just links) take the user to another webpage when they click on it.
This tag is used in a block of text to force a line break.
This tag creates a black line one pixel thick that runs the all the way across its container.
The img tag embeds an image into your HTML.
Unordered lists are just lists whose items are denoted with bullet points.

An element for displaying information in rows and columns. Supports headers and footers for labeling columns.
Sets off each row in a table
Sets off each cell in a row
This tag tells the browser what to display as the page title at the top and tells search engines what the title of your site is.
